thread.title: Bonds yields edge up ahead of CPI data | Markets
thread.title_full: Bonds yields edge up ahead of CPI data | Markets | BDlive

author: Staff Writer
title: Bonds yields edge up ahead of CPI data | Markets
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK THE South African bond market exhibited a weaker bias in late trade on Tuesday as the rand inched closer to the R13 to the dollar mark.
ETM Analytics analyst Ricardo da Camara said the release of consumer price index (CPI) data on Wednesday would provide the short-term trend for the bond market.
The CPI, which is used by the Reserve Bank to determine interest rates, is expected to have accelerated to 5% year on year in July from 4.7% in June‚ according to a median consensus forecast from a BDpro survey.
At 3.24pm the R186 was bid at 8.260% and offered at 8.250% from Monday’s close of 8.200%.
The R207 was bid at 7.760% and offered at 7.710% from a previous close of 7.705%.
The rand was at R12.9566 to the dollar from a close of R12.8988.
